item.title: # the hill
item.description: - It all began on top of the hill, excited and fun, and slowly slided down until they reached the ‚Äòvalley of despair‚Äô where all they can see is nothing but fog, mist, dark, and not everyone can get out of it, hence the name. item.title: # sleeping act
item.description: - He was laying, turning his body around and around to find a comfortable position to sleep. Yesterday he slept like a snail, curled everything up, the day before, a vampire, with both his arms and legs straight out, and the day before that, a butterfly, tomorrow maybe a giraffe, standing. Every time he found it, he only had one wish. He wishes to have a bullet fired through his head to make them stop running or a sword pierced through his heart to make it stop feeling.

item.title: # suddenly
item.description: - Childhood isn’t in some of those photographs, isn’t in those places you used to visit. It is when a familiar aroma suddenly hits your nose that makes you remember your mother’s breakfast, a familiar scent of the newly built house that makes you remember going out with your father to buy cement for your new home. A sudden scene of those kids playing with dirt makes you remember when you sneaked out to catch crickets with your friends at night.
